tit.e: Nara Hotel (an old established hotel in Nara City, Nara Prefecture)
Nara Hotel (an old established hotel in Nara City, Nara Prefecture)

sen.j: 奈良ホテル（ならホテル）は奈良県奈良市高畑町にある、1909年（明治42年）10月に営業開始した老舗のホテルである。
sen.e: Nara Hotel is an old firm hotel which is located in Takabatake-cho, Nara city, Nara prefecture and opened in October, 1909.
Nara Hotel is an old established hotel which is located in Takabatake Town, Nara City, Nara Prefecture and opened in October, 1909.
sen.cmt: 指示書に合わせ、表現を変えました。
sen.e: Nara Hotel is an old established hotel which is located in Takabatake Town, Nara City, Nara Prefecture and opened in October, 1909.

tit.cmt: ピリオド削除しました。

sen.j: 荒池の畔の小高い丘にある、大乗院跡地に建っており、興福寺、奈良公園などの観光地にも近い。
sen.e: It is located on a small rise of land near Ara-ike Pond, built on the remains of the Daijo-in Temple and is near to the tourist spots such as Kofuku-ji Temple, Nara Park and so on.
It stands in the remains of the Daijo-in Temple on a small rise of land near Ara-ike Pond, and is near to the tourist spots such as Kofuku-ji Temple, Nara Park and so on.
It stands in the remains of the Daijo-in Temple on a small rise of land near Ara-ike Pond, and is near to the tourist spots such as Kofuku-ji Temple, Nara Park and so on.

sen.j: 本館の建築は辰野金吾・片岡安による設計で桃山御殿檜造りの木造2階建て瓦葺き。
sen.e: The main building was designed and built by Kingo TATSUNO and Yasushi KATAOKA and is a tile-roofing Momoyama goten hinoki zukuri style and two-storied wooden construction.

The main building, designed by Kingo TATSUNO and Yasushi KATAOKA, is a tile-roofing two-storey building made of Japanese cypress in Momoyama style (luxurious, splendid and decorative style created during Momoyama period).
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせ、表現を変えました。
sen.e: The main building, designed by Kingo TATSUNO and Yasushi KATAOKA, is a tile-roofing two-storey building made of Japanese cypress in Momoyama style (luxurious, splendid and decorative style created during Momoyama period).

sen.j: 創業当時のものである。
sen.e: It remains the same as the opening.
It remains the same as the opening.
It remains the same as the opening.

sen.j: かつては国営（鉄道省直営）で関西における迎賓館的役割をになっていた。
sen.e: Once it played a role of a government-managed guesthouse (the direct management of Ministry of Railways) in Kansai.
Once it was run by the government (the direct management of Ministry of Railways) to play a role of a state guesthouse in Kansai region.
Once it was run by the government (the direct management of Ministry of Railways) to play a role of a state guesthouse in Kansai region.

sen.j: 今日でも著名人が多く宿泊し、皇族の奈良宿泊の際にはこのホテルが利用されることが専らである。
sen.e: Even today, many celebrities stay at this hotel, and when imperial families stay in Nara it is exclusively used.
Even today, many celebrities stay at this hotel; imperial families mainly use this hotel when they stay in Nara.
Even today, many celebrities stay at this hotel; imperial families mainly use this hotel when they stay in Nara.

sen.j: 廊下には上村松園、前田青邨らの絵画が飾られている。
sen.e: The paintings of Shoen UEMURA, Seison MAEDA and so on were put on the wall of the corridor.
The paintings of Shoen UEMURA, Seison MAEDA and so on are put on the wall of the corridor.
The paintings of Shoen UEMURA, Seison MAEDA and so on are put on the wall of the corridor.

sen.j: 当初は暖炉を暖房に用い、屋根に多数の煙突が設けられていた。
sen.e: At first fireplace was used for heating and lots of chimney pipes were put on the roof.
At first fireplace was used for heating and lots of chimney pipes were put on the roof.
At first fireplace was used for heating and lots of chimney pipes were put on the roof.

sen.j: 大正時代にスチームヒーターを導入した際にこれらの暖炉は廃止され、煙突は撤去されたものの、ロビーをはじめ各所に設けられていたマントルピースは現在に至るまで存続している。
sen.e: When steam heaters were introduced during Taisho period these fireplaces were abolished and the chimney pipes were removed, but the mantelpieces furnished in each place such as in the lobby and so on still exist up until the present.

When steam heaters were introduced during Taisho period these fireplaces were abolished and the chimney pipes were removed, but the mantelpieces furnished in each place such as in the lobby and so on still exist up until the present.

When steam heaters were introduced during Taisho period these fireplaces were abolished and the chimney pipes were removed, but the mantelpieces furnished in each place such as in the lobby and so on still exist up until the present.

sen.j: 1945年の終戦後、一時連合軍に接収された際に、白木仕上げの内外装が不潔であるとして、米兵によって全館ペンキ塗り潰しにされかかったが、当時の支配人の必死の説得で欄干など直接手が触れる部分のみ朱塗りとすることで本体を守った、というエピソードがあり、1960年代末までは内装の間取りの変更はあったものの、概ね創建当時の姿を保っていた。
sen.e: When it was temporarily taken over by the allied forces after the war in 1945, as an episode, the interior and exterior design made of plain wood were considered to be unclean and were nearly painted out by American soldiers, but the manager in those days desperately tried to persuade them not to paint out and only a part where hands directly touched was painted vermilion-lacquered and thus they were protected, and until the end of 1960s it kept the original form same as the opening days though the room arrangement of the interior design was changed.

There is an episode when it was temporarily taken over by the allied forces after the war in 1945, U.S. soldiers tried to paint out the interior and exterior design considering them unclean, but the main part were protected while only a part where hands directly touched was painted vermilion-lacquered by the desperate persuasion of the hotel manager in those days; until the end of 1960s it kept the original form almost the same as the opening days, while the room arrangement of the interior design was changed.

There is an episode when it was temporarily taken over by the allied forces after the war in 1945, U.S. soldiers tried to paint out the interior and exterior design considering them unclean, but the main part were protected while only a part where hands directly touched was painted vermilion-lacquered by the desperate persuasion of the hotel manager in those days; until the end of 1960s it kept the original form almost the same as the opening days, while the room arrangement of the interior design was changed.

sen.j: その後、1970年に開催された日本万国博覧会に備えて収容力の拡大を図るべく、本館食堂の南側に高層ビル形態の新館建設を計画し、基礎工事まで済ませたが、景観保護にかかる諸条例の規制区域であったため、これは中止となり、その基礎を生かして近代的な外観の半地下式グリルが新設され、これに伴い不要となったラウンジが撤去されるに留まった。
sen.e: Later, to expand the holding capacity for preparing the Japan World Exposition '70 held in 1970, a new building of a high-rise building form was planned to be built in the south side of the main building eating facility and the basic foundation construction was finished, but it was called off because the area was regulated by several regulations as for scenic reserve and a half-underground grillroom, whose appearance was modern, was newly built on its basis and the lounge which came to be unnecessary with this construction was removed.

Later, to expand the capacity for the Japan World Exposition '70 held in 1970, a new high-rise building was planned to be built at the south of the dining room of the main building, but because the area was under several regulations as for scenic reserve, it was called off when the basic foundation was completed of which a modern half-underground grillroom has been newly built on the base; in accordance with it, the unnecessary lounge was removed.

Later, to expand the capacity for the Japan World Exposition '70 held in 1970, a new high-rise building was planned to be built at the south of the dining room of the main building, but because the area was under several regulations as for scenic reserve, it was called off when the basic foundation was completed of which a modern half-underground grillroom has been newly built on the base; in accordance with it, the unnecessary lounge was removed.

sen.j: この際、当初計画に対する収容力の不足を補うため、同時期に建設が計画された近鉄奈良駅ビルの上層階を別館として1970年に営業開始したが、これは1984年のわかくさ国民体育大会、および1988年の「なら・シルクロード博覧会」の開催を控え、1984年に本館の建つ高台の南側傾斜面を削り込んで埋め込む形で鉄筋コンクリート造りの新館を国鉄の設計による吉野造りで建設したことでその必要性が大幅に低下し、「なら・シルクロード博覧会」閉幕後もしばらくは営業を続けたが、結局1991年にこの別館は閉鎖されている。
sen.e: At that time, to compensate for the lack of holding capacity in the first plan, it began to be operated in 1970, in which the higher elevations of Kintetsu Nara Station Building, which was planned to be built during the same period, was the annex, but the necessity dramatically decreased because in 1984 a new building of steel-reinforced concrete was designed by Japan National Railways and built in yoshino-tsukuri style, where it was embedded by digging the south slope of rising ground on which the main building stood, for preparing for Wakakusa National Athletic Meet in 1984 and 'Nara Silk Road Expo' in 1988, and also after the closing of 'Nara Silk Road Expo' it continued to be operated for a while, but eventually in 1991 this annex was closed.
sen.cmt: 「近鉄奈良駅ビル」を、Kintetsu Nara Station Buildingとしました。
sen.e: On this occasion, to compensate for the lack of capacity in the first plan for Wakakusa National Athletic Meet in 1984 and 'Nara Silk Road Expo' in 1988, the annex was began to be operated in 1970 using the higher storeys of Kintetsu Nara Station Building which was planned to be built at the same period, however, it decreased its necessity dramatically due to the new building of steel-reinforced concrete built in 1984 in Yoshino-tsukuri style (an architectural technique for building on a sheer cliff) by Japan National Railways, which was embedded by digging the south slope of rising ground where the main building stood, and was eventually closed in 1991 although running for a while after the closing of 'Nara Silk Road Expo.'

On this occasion, to compensate for the lack of capacity in the first plan for Wakakusa National Athletic Meet in 1984 and 'Nara Silk Road Expo' in 1988, the annex was began to be operated in 1970 using the higher storeys of Kintetsu Nara Station Building which was planned to be built at the same period, however, it decreased its necessity dramatically due to the new building of steel-reinforced concrete built in 1984 in Yoshino-tsukuri style (an architectural technique for building on a sheer cliff) by Japan National Railways, which was embedded by digging the south slope of rising ground where the main building stood, and was eventually closed in 1991 although running for a while after the closing of 'Nara Silk Road Expo.'

sen.j: 現在は株式会社奈良ホテルが経営しており、資本金は4億円。
sen.e: Now Kabushiki-gaisha Nara Hotel manages it and the capital fund is four hundred million.
Now Nara Hotel Co., Ltd. manages the hotel with 400 million capital fund.
Now Nara Hotel Co., Ltd. manages the hotel with 400 million capital fund.

sen.j: うち西日本旅客鉄道株式会社が50%、都ホテルズリゾーツが50%出資する。
sen.e: Among them, 50% is invested by West Japan Railway Company (JR West) and 50% by Miyako Hotels & Resorts.
Among them, West Japan Railway Company (JR West) invested 50 percents and Miyako Hotels & Resorts 50 percents.
Among them, West Japan Railway Company (JR West) invested 50 percents and Miyako Hotels & Resorts 50 percents.

sen.j: このため、JR西日本、近畿日本鉄道の両系列下にあり、JR西日本ホテルズと都ホテルズリゾーツ両方に加盟するホテルである。
sen.e: For this reason, it is under both JR West and Kinki Nippon Railway Company and it becomes a member of both JR-West Hotels and Miyako Hotels & Resorts.
For this reason, it is under both JR West and Kinki Nippon Railway Company and it becomes a member of both JR-West Hotels and Miyako Hotels & Resorts.
For this reason, it is under both JR West and Kinki Nippon Railway Company and it becomes a member of both JR-West Hotels and Miyako Hotels & Resorts.

sen.j: これは、関西本線の前身に当たる私鉄の関西鉄道が土地を取得してホテルを建設し、京都の都ホテル（現・ウェスティン都ホテル京都）が運営に当たっていたためである。
sen.e: This was because a private railway (company) Kansai Railway Company, which was the predecessor of Kansai Main Line, purchased the area and built a hotel and Miyako Hotel in Kyoto (currently, The Westin Miyako Kyoto) managed it.

This was because a private railway (company) Kansai Railway Company, which was the predecessor of Kansai Main Line, purchased the area and built a hotel managed by Miyako Hotel in Kyoto (currently, The Westin Miyako Kyoto).

This was because a private railway (company) Kansai Railway Company, which was the predecessor of Kansai Main Line, purchased the area and built a hotel managed by Miyako Hotel in Kyoto (currently, The Westin Miyako Kyoto).

sen.j: 1983年に会社を設立し、当初は日本国有鉄道と都ホテルの共同出資でスタート、後に国鉄出資分はJR西日本に、都ホテル出資分は近鉄ホテルシステムズに引き継がれた。
sen.e: The company was established in 1983 and at first it started by joint capital investment of Japan National Railways (JNR) and Miyako Hotel and later the investment of Japan National Railways was succeeded to JR West and the one of Miyako Hotel was to Kintetsu Hotel Systems Co., Ltd..

The company was established in 1983 by joint capital investment of Japan National Railways (JNR) and Miyako Hotel at first, and later the investment of Japan National Railways was succeeded to JR West and the one of Miyako Hotel was to Kintetsu Hotel Systems Co., Ltd.

The company was established in 1983 by joint capital investment of Japan National Railways (JNR) and Miyako Hotel at first, and later the investment of Japan National Railways was succeeded to JR West and the one of Miyako Hotel was to Kintetsu Hotel Systems Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 本館においては新館完成後も従来の調度品が修理を重ねつつ長く使用されてきたが、2006年に寝具や家具、それにエアコンの全面的な更新が実施され、面目を一新した。
sen.e: In the main building, the traditional furniture had been used for a long time by repeated repairs even after the completion of a new building, but in 2006 the bed clothes, the furniture, the air conditioners were wholly renewed and it underwent a complete change.

In the main building, the traditional furniture had been used for a long time by repeated repairs even after the completion of a new building, but in 2006 the bed clothes, the furniture, and the air conditioners were wholly renewed and it underwent a complete change.

In the main building, the traditional furniture had been used for a long time by repeated repairs even after the completion of a new building, but in 2006 the bed clothes, the furniture, and the air conditioners were wholly renewed and it underwent a complete change.
